head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: New Charges Against Bonanno Family

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: New Charges Against Bonanno Family
hedline.hl2: Brooklyn: New Charges Against Bonanno Family

abstract.p: Nicholas Santora, whom prosecutors describe as acting underboss of Bonanno crime family, and 19 other alleged members of family are charged with conspiracy to commit murder, racketeering, loan sharking and drug offenses at Federal District court in Brooklyn; prosecutor says that more than 100 Bonanno family members and associates have been prosecuted in ongoing investigation; photo (S)

block.p: Federal prosecutors unveiled racketeering charges yesterday against 19 people they said were members of the Bonanno crime family. The indictment, unsealed yesterday in Federal District Court, includes charges of racketeering, conspiracy to commit murder, loan sharking and drug offenses, federal prosecutors said. One suspect is Nicholas Santora, above, described as the acting underboss, said Roslynn R. Mauskopf, the United States attorney in Brooklyn. All 19 pleaded not guilty yesterday, prosecutors said. Ms. Mauskopf said that as part of an ongoing investigation, more than 100 Bonanno family members and associates have been prosecuted.
